title: Biome (formerly called Nebulon) is now available
content:
Hi Typophiles,

I've got some more to do to get the little splash site working properly, but I wanted to announce that Biome Wide is now available on [fonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414174032/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=4657264&) and [itcfonts.com.](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414174032/http:/www.itcfonts.com/fonts/font/pid/4657264/Biome+Wide+Full+Family/detail&grab_id=0&page_id=97843&query=biome) More resellers coming up. Take a look at

[http://biometype.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414174032/http:/biometype.com/ "http://biometype.com")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414174032im_/http:/typophile.com/files/tphileshow_4513.gif)
author: crossgrove

comments.content: Good stuff. I'm not sure why, but it really tickles me that Biome has old-style figures available.
Phonetically it's BY-ohm. Simple. Means ecosystem.

Carl, I noticed Nebulon in TDC's Typography 30 and was very taken with it. It looks very legible in that tiny-size text sample. Congratulations for being selected for excellence in type design.

Considering all the styles and weights the renaming must have been a pain.

Hi Nick!

As you probably know, naming isn't fun in FL anyway. The challenge seems to be getting all those fields filled correctly. Note that this release is only the Wide set; Square and Narrow sets to come later.

Directly from Monotype - but it's already too late. :-( Their "fire sales" last only one day (plus there's a limit of 200 units).

hhp
